result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry Michael Palzkill

records.addlTxt: Motion for Stay of Entry of Judgment, Stipulated Conditions for Dismissal, and Order for Stay of Entry of Judgment and Dismissal

3:16 PM 
Defendant Terry Michael Palzkill in court.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Terry Michael Palzkill. 
Attorney Sauder Informs the court this matter is resolved and files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "NO CONTEST" .
Court questions defendant re: his plea and waiver of rights.
Court questions attorney Sauder re: her clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY". 

State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Sauder joins in the motions.

Court Orders: Sentence Withheld DPA for a Period of 1 Year with Conditions
See motion for complete list of conditions.

2:46 PM 
Defendant Terry Michael Palzkill in court.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Terry Michael Palzkill. 
Attorney Sauder informs the court this matter is resolved and moves for plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.

 Defendant Terry Michael Palzkill in court with attorney Morgan Sauder. Prosecuting Atty Corinne L Frutiger appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Corinne Frutiger appears special today Jenna L Gill in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Sauder and  Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint formal reading is waived.
